name: water pump production, 22kW | water pump, 22kW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21077/documentation

This dataset represents the production of a water pump with a power of 22 kW. The inventory is approximated based on the dataset "pump production, 40W, CH" (for the input materials) and the dataset "heat pump production, brine-water, 10kW, CH" (for the energy inputs). This dataset should only be used in cases where its contribution to the overall impacts of the studied system is expected to be small.;The assumed characteristics of the pump are based on Nemecek et al. (2007), and correspond to an average pump used for agricultural irrigation: the total mass of the pump is 300 kg and the engine nominal power is 22 kW with a volumetric capacity of 30 m3/h for a delivery pressure of 7 to 8 bar.;This water pump is meant to be used as a generic irrigation pump (both for surface water and groundwater).;Reference:;Nemecek T., K채gi T. and Blaser S. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Agricultural Production Systems. Final report ecoinvent v2.0 No.15. Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, D체bendorf, CH.

This activity starts with the supply of the input materials at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the assembled pump at the exit of the factory. The treatment and disposal of the pump is taken into account through the waste outputs.
Due to lack of data, the energy required to assemble the pump, as well as the infrastructure use, are roughly approximated.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2812:Manufacture of fluid power equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The materials listed in the inventory are assumed to be those used currently for the production of water pumps.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset does not have a specific geographical location. It is assumed to be valid at the global scale.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The input materials are extrapolated based on the dataset "pump production, 40W, CH", accessed in version 3.4 of the database.
The energy inputs are copied from the dataset "heat pump production, brine-water, 10kW, CH", accessed in version 3.4 of the database.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The inventory is extrapolated based on the dataset "pump production, 40W, CH". The total mass of the pump is 300 kg, which is the assumed mass of an average pump used for agricultural irrigation (Nemecek et al., 2007). This mass was used to extrapolate the amounts of the input materials.
The energy consumption is approximated with the energy inputs of the dataset "heat pump production, brine-water, 10kW, CH".

Reference:
Nemecek T., K채gi T. and Blaser S. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Agricultural Production Systems. Final report ecoinvent v2.0 No.15. Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, D체bendorf, CH.
